    "title": "The Invisible Thread",
    "logline": "Two continents, two cultures, two sisters—when a midnight phone call sends Isa and Caro racing toward opposite ends of the globe, their only map is the unbreakable bond they once took for granted.",
    "description": "Isa Mendoza-Weber, an ER nurse in Strasbourg, has spent years measuring love in heartbeats and milligrams, her children raised on video calls and croissants. Half a world away, her younger sister Carolina \"Caro\" Mendoza-Kim has built a quiet fortress in Seoul’s neon sprawl, homeschooling her twins in three languages while her husband deploys with the UN. The sisters haven’t touched in seven years—until a single email containing a childhood photograph, a set of coordinates, and the line, ‘We are losing the thread.’ With no explanation, Isa books a red-eye east and Caro boards a westbound train, each carrying half of a torn family locket. Between them lie 5,500 miles, two passports, one blizzard, and the sudden certainty that the distance they accepted was never geography—it was fear. As they zigzag toward the DMZ’s abandoned peace garden where their story began, the women must choose between the safe lives they have engineered and the raw, messy love that once made them fearless. A novella-length Hero’s Journey told in alternating voices, The Invisible Thread asks how far we will travel to forgive the people who know our first names and our worst mistakes."
